caption: The photograph depicts an outdoor setting where a large flock of birds, specifically gulls, is seen in mid-flight above a dumpsite. The foreground shows mounds of garbage over which the birds are flying, likely searching for food. On the right side of the image, there is a large yellow bulldozer, indicating active work or management of the dumpsite area. The background is composed of a dense line of conifers, typical of a forested area, and beyond these trees, mountainous terrain can be partially glimpsed under an overcast sky. A sign with the words "DUMP HERE" is visible near the bulldozer, providing further context to the function of the area as a waste disposal site. The overall setting suggests a rural or semi-remote location where wildlife interacts with human-affected landscapes.
title: Herring gulls and trash at the Lake Placid, New York landfill, in the Adirondack Forest Preserve. These gulls are proliferating due to abundant food aVailable year-round at landfills. Their range is extending and the species is causing competition and conflict with other seabird species, especially the terns.
